arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“We	have	accepted	 faith	in	 the	
Lord	Of	The	Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole	hum	Imān	lāye	jahān	ke	Rab	par

arabicText: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَـٰرُونَ
englishTranslationText: “The	Lord	of	Moosa	and	Haroon.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	Rab	hai	Mūsā aur	Hāroon	ka.

arabicText: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ ءَامَنتُم بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَمَكْرٌۭ مَّكَرْتُمُوهُ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ لِتُخْرِجُوا۟ مِنْهَآ أَهْلَهَا ۖ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	 Firaun,	 “You	 have	 accepted	 faith	 in	
Him	before	I	gave	you	permission!	This	is	
indeed	 a	 grand	 conspiracy	 you	 have	
plotted	 in	 the	 city,	 in	 order	 to	 expel	 its	
people	 from	 it;	 so	 now	 you	 will	 come	 to	
know!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Fir'aun	bola	tum	is	par	Imān	le	āaye	qabl	is	
ke	ki maiñ	tumheiñ	ijāzat	dooñ yeh	to	bada	
ja’l	 (Makr-o-Fareb)	 hai	 jo	 tum	 sab	 ne	
shaher	meiñ	phailaya	hai	ke	shaher	waloñ		
ko	is	se	nikāl	do	to	ab	jān	jāo	ge

arabicText: لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍۢ ثُمَّ لَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“I	swear	I	will	cut	off	your	hands	and	your	
feet	 from	alternate	sides	and	 then	crucify	
you	all.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Qasam	 hai	 ke	 maiñ	 tumhāre	 ek	 taraf	 ke	
hāth	aur	doosri	taraf	ke	pāoñ	kātoñga	phir	
tum	sab	ko	sooli	dooñga

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“We	shall	return	to	our	Lord.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	 hum	 apne	 Rab	 ki	 taraf	 phirne	 wāle	
haiñ

arabicText: وَمَا تَنقِمُ مِنَّآ إِلَّآ أَنْ ءَامَنَّا بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّنَا لَمَّا جَآءَتْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَآ أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًۭا وَتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	what	did	you	dislike	in	us,	except	that	
we	believed	in	the	signs	of	our	Lord	when	
they	 came	 to	 us?	Our	 Lord!	Pour	(bestow	
abundantly)	patience	on	us,	and	bestow	us	
death	as	Muslims.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tujhe	hamāra	kya	bura	laga	yehi	na	ke	
hum	apne	Rab	ki	nishāniyoñ		par	imān	lāye	
jab	 woh	 hamāre	 pās	 āayiñ	 	 aey	 Rab	
hamāre!	 Hum	 par	 sabr	 undel	 de	 aur	
hameiñ	Musalman	utha

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِ فِرْعَوْنَ أَتَذَرُ مُوسَىٰ وَقَوْمَهُۥ لِيُفْسِدُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَيَذَرَكَ وَءَالِهَتَكَ ۚ قَالَ سَنُقَتِّلُ أَبْنَآءَهُمْ وَنَسْتَحْىِۦ نِسَآءَهُمْ وَإِنَّا فَوْقَهُمْ قَـٰهِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	chieftains	of	Firaun’s	people	said,	“Are	
you	 releasing	 Moosa	 and	 his	 people	 to	
cause	turmoil	in	the	land,	and	for	Moosa	to	
abandon	you	and	your	appointed	deities?”	
He	said,	“We	shall	now	slay	their	sons	and	
spare	 their	 women;	 and	 indeed	 we	 have	
power	over	them.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	qaum-e-fir'aun	 ke	sardār	bole	 kya	 tu	
Mūsā aur	uski	qaum	ko is	liye	chhodta	hai	
ke	woh	zameen	meiñ	fasād	phailayeñ	aur	
Moosa	 tujhe	 aur	 tere	 thehrāye	 huwe	
m’aboodoñ	ko	chhod	de	bola	ab	hum	inke	
betoñ	 ko	 qatl	 kareñge	 aur	 inki	 betiyāñ	
zinda	rakheñ	ge	aur	hum	be-shak	in	par	ghalib	haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ ٱسْتَعِينُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱصْبِرُوٓا۟ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلْأَرْضَ لِلَّهِ يُورِثُهَا مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ ۖ وَٱلْعَـٰقِبَةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Moosa	said	to	his	people,	“Seek	the	help	of	
Allah and	patiently	endure;	indeed	the	Owner	of	the	earth	is	Allah - He	appoints	as	its	successor	
whomever	He	wills;	and	the	final	triumph	is	for	the	pious.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā ne	apni	qaum	se	 farmaya	Allah	ki	madad	chāho	aur	sabr	karo	be-shak	zameen	ka	mālik	
Allah	hai	apne	bandoñ	meiñ	jise	chāhe	wāris	banaye	aur	āakhir	maidān	parhez	gāroñ	ke	hāth	hai

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ أُوذِينَا مِن قَبْلِ أَن تَأْتِيَنَا وَمِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جِئْتَنَا ۚ قَالَ عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَن يُهْلِكَ عَدُوَّكُمْ وَيَسْتَخْلِفَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرَ كَيْفَ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“We	have	been	oppressed	before	you	came	to	us,	and	after	you	have	come	to	us”;	he	
said,	“It	is	likely	that	your	Lord	may	destroy	your	enemy	and	in	his	place	make	you	the	rulers	of	
the	earth,	and	then	see	what	deeds	you	perform.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	hum	satāaye	gaye	āap	ke	āane	se	pehle	aur	āap	ke	tashreef	lāne	ke	b’ad	kahā:	Qareeb	hai	ke	
tumhāra	Rab	tumhāre	dushman	ko	halāk	kare	aur	uski	jagah	zameen	ka	mālik	tumheiñ	banaye	
phir	dekhe	kaise	kām	karte	ho

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَآ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ بِٱلسِّنِينَ وَنَقْصٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	seized	the	people	of	Firaun	with	a	famine	of	several	years	and	with	reduction	of	
fruits,	so	that	they	may	follow	advice.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hum	ne	fir'aun	waloñ		ko	barsoñ	ke	qahet	aur	phaloñ	ke	ghatāne	se	pakda	ke	kaheeñ	
woh	nasihat māneiñ.

arabicText: فَإِذَا جَآءَتْهُمُ ٱلْحَسَنَةُ قَالُوا۟ لَنَا هَـٰذِهِۦ ۖ وَإِن تُصِبْهُمْ سَيِّئَةٌۭ يَطَّيَّرُوا۟ بِمُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥٓ ۗ أَلَآ إِنَّمَا طَـٰٓئِرُهُمْ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So when	 good	 would	 reach	 them	 they	
would	 say,	 “This	 is	 for	 us”;	 and	 when	
misfortune	reached	them,	they	would	infer	
it	 as	 ill	 omens	 of	 Moosa	 and	 his	
companions;	pay	heed!	The	misfortune	of	
their	 ill	 luck	 lies	 with	 Allah,	 but	 most	 of	
them	are	unaware.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 jab	 unheiñ	 	 bhalāi	 milti	 kahte	 yeh	
hamāre	liye	hai	aur	jab	burāyi	pahuñchti	to	
Mūsā aur	uske	sāth	waloñ		se	bad	shagooni	
lete	 sun	 lo	 unke	 nasibe	 (Muqaddar)	 ki	
shāmatto	Allah	ke	yahāñ		hai	lekin	un	meiñ	
aksar	ko	khabar	nahi.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ مَهْمَا تَأْتِنَا بِهِۦ مِنْ ءَايَةٍۢ لِّتَسْحَرَنَا بِهَا فَمَا نَحْنُ لَكَ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	said,	“You	may	come	with	any	sign	to	
us,	in	order	to	cast	a	magic	spell	on	us	- yet	
by	 no	 means	 are	 we	 going	 to	 believe	 in	
you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 bole	 tum	 kaisi	 bhi	 nishāni	 lekar	
hamāre	pās	āao	ke	hum	par	us	se	jādu	karo	
hum	 kisi	 tarah	 tum	 par	 Imān	 lāne	 wāle	
nahi

arabicText: فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلطُّوفَانَ وَٱلْجَرَادَ وَٱلْقُمَّلَ وَٱلضَّفَادِعَ وَٱلدَّمَ ءَايَـٰتٍۢ مُّفَصَّلَـٰتٍۢ فَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ قَوْمًۭا مُّجْرِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	 therefore	sent	against	 them	 the	 flood	
and	the	locusts	and	the	vermin	(or	insects)	
and	 the	 frogs	 and	 the	 blood	 - separate	
signs;	 in	 response	 they	 were	 proud	 and	
were	a	guilty	people.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 bhejā	 hum	 ne	 un	 par	 toofān	 aur	 tedi	
(tiddi)	 aur	 ghun	 (kilni	 ya	 juweiñ)	 aur	
meñdak	aur	khooñ	juda	juda	nishāniyāñ	to	
unhoñ	 ne	 takabbur	 kiya	aur	woh	mujrim	
qaum	thi	.

arabicText: وَلَمَّا وَقَعَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلرِّجْزُ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰمُوسَى ٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ بِمَا عَهِدَ عِندَكَ ۖ لَئِن كَشَفْتَ عَنَّا ٱلرِّجْزَ لَنُؤْمِنَنَّ لَكَ وَلَنُرْسِلَنَّ مَعَكَ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
englishTranslationText:
And	whenever	the	punishment	came	upon	
them	 they	 said,	 “O	 Moosa!	 Pray	 to	 your	
Lord	 for	 us,	 by	 means	 of	 His	 covenant	
which	 you	 have;	 indeed	 if	 you	 lift	 the	
punishment	from	us	we	will	surely	accept	
faith	 in	 you	 and	 let	 the	 Descendants	 of	
Israel	go	with	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 un	 par	 ‘aƶāb	 	 padta	 kahte	 aey	
Mūsā!	Hamāre	liye	apne	Rab	se	du’a	karo	
us	‘ahed	ke	sabab	jo	uska	tumhāre	pās	hai	
be-shak agar	tum	hum	par	‘aƶāb		utha	doge	
to	hum	zaroor	tum	par	imān	lāayeñ	ge	aur	
bani	Israeel	ko	tumhāre	sāth	kar	deñge	.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا كَشَفْنَا عَنْهُمُ ٱلرِّجْزَ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ هُم بَـٰلِغُوهُ إِذَا هُمْ يَنكُثُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Consequently	 whenever	 We	 lifted	 the	
punishment	 from	 them	 for	 a	 term	 which	
they	 must	 reach,	 they	 used	 to	 then	 turn	
away.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	 jab	 hum	 un	 se	 ‘aƶāb	 	 utha	 lete	 ek	
muddat	ke	liye	jis	tak	unheiñ		pahuñchna	
hai	jabhi	woh	phir	jāte.

arabicText: فَٱنتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ فَأَغْرَقْنَـٰهُمْ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَكَانُوا۟ عَنْهَا غَـٰفِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	therefore	took	revenge	from	them;	so	We	drowned	them	in	the	sea	for	they	used	to	deny	Our	
signs	and	were	ignoring	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Hum	ne	un	se	badla	liya	to	unheiñ		dariya	meiñ	dubo	diya	is	liye	ke	Hamāri	āayateiñ	jhutlāte	
aur	un	se	be-khabar	they

arabicText: وَأَوْرَثْنَا ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَانُوا۟ يُسْتَضْعَفُونَ مَشَـٰرِقَ ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَغَـٰرِبَهَا ٱلَّتِى بَـٰرَكْنَا فِيهَا ۖ وَتَمَّتْ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ عَلَىٰ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ ۖ وَدَمَّرْنَا مَا كَانَ يَصْنَعُ فِرْعَوْنُ وَقَوْمُهُۥ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْرِشُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	made	the	people	who	were	oppressed,	the	inheritors	of	the	eastern and	western	parts	
of	the	land	in	which	We	placed	blessings;	and	the	good	promise	of	your	Lord	was	fulfilled	for	the	
Descendants	of	Israel	- the	reward	of	their	patience;	and	We	destroyed	whatever	Firaun	and	his	
people	built	and	whatever	they	had	contrived.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hum	ne	us	qaum	 ko	jo	dabā	li	 (Kamzor	samjhi)	gayi	 thi	is	zameen	 ke	poorab	pachchhim	
(Mashriq-o-Maghrib) ka	wāris	kiya	jis	meiñ	Hum	ne	barkat	rakhi	aur	tere	Rab	ka	achchha	w’āda	
Bani	Isra’il	par	poora	huwa	badla	unke	sabr	ka	aur	hum	ne	barbād	kar	diya	jo	kuchh	fir'aun	aur	
uski	qaum	banāti	aur	jo	chunaiyān	uthāte	(T’ameer	karte)	they.

arabicText: وَجَـٰوَزْنَا بِبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱلْبَحْرَ فَأَتَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍۢ يَعْكُفُونَ عَلَىٰٓ أَصْنَامٍۢ لَّهُمْ ۚ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰمُوسَى ٱجْعَل لَّنَآ إِلَـٰهًۭا كَمَا لَهُمْ ءَالِهَةٌۭ ۚ قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌۭ تَجْهَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 transported	 the	 Descendants	 of	
Israel	across	the	sea	- so	they	came	across	
a	people	who	used	to	squat	in	seclusion	in	
front	 of	 their	 idols;	 they	 said,	 “O	 Moosa!	
Make	 a	 God	 for	 us,	 the	way	 they	 have	 so	
many	Gods!”	He	 said,	 “You	are	indeed	an	
ignorant people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hum	ne	Bani	Isra’il	ko	dariya	pār	utāra	
to	 unka	 guzar	 ek	 aisi	 qaum	 par	 huwa	 ke	
apne	butoñ	ke	āage	āasan	māre	(Ibādat	ke	
liye	jam	kar	baithey)	they	bole	aey	Mūsā!	
hameiñ	 ek	 khuda	 banā	 de	 jaisa	 inke	 liye	
itne	khuda	haiñ bola	 tum	zaroor	jāhil	log	
ho

arabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ مُتَبَّرٌۭ مَّا هُمْ فِيهِ وَبَـٰطِلٌۭ مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“The	condition	they	are	in	is,	in	fact,	one	of	
destruction	- and	all	what	they	do	is	utter	
falsehood.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	hāl	to	barbādi	ka	hai	jis	meiñ	yeh	log	
haiñ	 aur	 jo	 kuchh	 kar	 rahe	 haiñ	 nira	
(Bilkul)	bātil	hai

arabicText: قَالَ أَغَيْرَ ٱللَّهِ أَبْغِيكُمْ إِلَـٰهًۭا وَهُوَ فَضَّلَكُمْ عَلَى ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	 “Shall	 I	seek	 for	you	a	God	other	
than	 Allah,	 whereas	 He	 has	 given	 you	
superiority	 above	 the	 entire	 world?”	(By	
sending	His	message	towards	you).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā:	Kya	Allah	 ke	 siwa	 tumhāra	aur	 koi	
khuda	 talāsh	 karooñ	 halāñke	 usne	
tumheiñ	zamāne	bhar	par	fazilat	di

arabicText: وَإِذْ أَنجَيْنَـٰكُم مِّنْ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَسُومُونَكُمْ سُوٓءَ ٱلْعَذَابِ ۖ يُقَتِّلُونَ أَبْنَآءَكُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ نِسَآءَكُمْ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكُم بَلَآءٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	remember	when	We	rescued	you	from	
Firaun’s	 people	 who	 were	 afflicting	 you	
with	a	dreadful	torment;	slaughtering	your	
sons	and	sparing	your	daughters;	and	in	it	
was	a	great	favour	from	your	Lord
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	jab	Hum	ne	tumheiñ	fir'aun	
waloñ	 	 se	 najāt	 bakhshi	 ke	 tumheiñ	 buri	
mār	 dete	 tumhāre	 bete	 zibah	 karte	 aur	
tumhāri	 betiyāñ	 bāqi	 rakhte	 aur	 is	 meiñ	
tumhāre	Rab	ka	bada	fazl	huwa

arabicText: ۞ وَوَٰعَدْنَا مُوسَىٰ ثَلَـٰثِينَ لَيْلَةًۭ وَأَتْمَمْنَـٰهَا بِعَشْرٍۢ فَتَمَّ مِيقَـٰتُ رَبِّهِۦٓ أَرْبَعِينَ لَيْلَةًۭ ۚ وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَخِيهِ هَـٰرُونَ ٱخْلُفْنِى فِى قَوْمِى وَأَصْلِحْ وَلَا تَتَّبِعْ سَبِيلَ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	agreed	with	Moosa	a	covenant	for	
thirty	nights	(of	solitude)	and	completed	it	
by	adding	ten	to	them,	so	the	covenant	of	
His	Lord	amounted	 to	 forty	nights	in	 full;	
and	Moosa	said	to	his	brother	Haroon,	“Be	
my	 deputy	 over	 my	 people	 and	 make	
reform	 and	 do	 not	 allow	 the	 ways	 of	 the	
mischievous to	enter.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 hum	 ne	 Mūsā se	 tees	 rāt	 ka	 w’ada	
farmaya	 aur	 un	 meiñ	 dus	 aur	 badhā kar	
poori	 keiñ	 to	 uske	 Rab	 ka	 w’āda	 poori	
chalees	 rāt	 ka	 huwa	 aur	 Moosa	 ne	 apne	
bhai	Haroon	se	kahā	meri	qaum	par	mere	nāyib	rehna	aur	islāh	karna	aur	fasādiyoñ	ki	rāh	ko	
dakhl	na	dena	(unke	rāstey	par	na	chalna)	.

arabicText: ۞ وَلَمَّا جَآءَ مُوسَىٰ لِمِيقَـٰتِنَا وَكَلَّمَهُۥ رَبُّهُۥ قَالَ رَبِّ أَرِنِىٓ أَنظُرْ إِلَيْكَ ۚ قَالَ لَن تَرَىٰنِى وَلَـٰكِنِ ٱنظُرْ إِلَى ٱلْجَبَلِ فَإِنِ ٱسْتَقَرَّ مَكَانَهُۥ فَسَوْفَ تَرَىٰنِى ۚ فَلَمَّا تَجَلَّىٰ رَبُّهُۥ لِلْجَبَلِ جَعَلَهُۥ دَكًّۭا وَخَرَّ مُوسَىٰ صَعِقًۭا ۚ فَلَمَّآ أَفَاقَ قَالَ سُبْحَـٰنَكَ تُبْتُ إِلَيْكَ وَأَنَا۠ أَوَّلُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Moosa presented	himself	upon	Our	promise,	and	his	Lord	spoke	to	him,	he	said,	“My	
Lord!	Show	me	Your	Self,	so	that	I	may	see	You”;	He	said,	“You	will	never	be	able	to	see	Me,	but	
look	towards	the	mountain	- if	it	stays	in	its	place,	then	you	shall	soon	see	Me”; so	when	his	Lord	
directed	His	light	on	the	mountain,	He	blew	it	into	bits	and	Moosa	fell	down	unconscious;	then	
upon	regaining	consciousness	he	said,	“Purity	is	to	You!	I	incline	towards	You,	and	I	am	the	first	
Muslim.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Mūsā hamāre	w’āde	par	hāzir	huwa	aur	us	se	uske	Rab	ne	kalām	farmaya	‘arz	ki	aey	Rab	
mere!	Mujhe	apna	didār	dikha	ke	maiñ	tujhe	dekhooñ	farmaya	tu	mujhe	hargiz	na	dekh	sakega	
hān	is	pahād	ki	taraf	dekh	yeh	agar	apni	jagah	par	thehra	raha	to	‘an-qareeb	tu	mujhe	dekh	lega	
phir	jab	uske	Rab	ne	pahād	par	apna	Noor	chamkāya	usey	pāsh	pāsh	kar	diya	aur	Moosa	gira	
behosh	phir	jab	hosh	huwa	bola	pāki	hai	tujhe	maiñ	teri	taraf	ruju'	lāya	aur	maiñ	sab	se	pehla	
Musalman	hooñ

arabicText: ۞ قَالَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنِّى ٱصْطَفَيْتُكَ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ بِرِسَـٰلَـٰتِى وَبِكَلَـٰمِى فَخُذْ مَآ ءَاتَيْتُكَ وَكُن مِّنَ ٱلشَّـٰكِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	 Allah,	 “O	 Moosa!	 I	 have	 chosen	 you	
from	 mankind	 by	 (bestowing)	 My	
messages	 and	 by	 My	 speech;	 so	 accept	
what	 I	 have	 bestowed	 upon	 you	 and	 be	
among	the	thankful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmaya	aey	Mūsā!	Maiñ	ne	tujhe	logoñ	se	
chun	liya	apni	Risālatoñ	aur	apne	Kalām	se	
to	 le	 jo	 Maiñ	 ne	 tujhe	 ‘aṭa	 farmaya	 aur	
shukr	waloñ		meiñ	ho.

arabicText: وَكَتَبْنَا لَهُۥ فِى ٱلْأَلْوَاحِ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ مَّوْعِظَةًۭ وَتَفْصِيلًۭا لِّكُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ فَخُذْهَا بِقُوَّةٍۢ وَأْمُرْ قَوْمَكَ يَأْخُذُوا۟ بِأَحْسَنِهَا ۚ سَأُو۟رِيكُمْ دَارَ ٱلْفَـٰسِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	wrote	 for	him	on	 the	 tablets,	 the	
advice	 for	all	 things	and	 the	 details	 of	all	
things;	 and	 commanded	 “Accept	it	 firmly	
and	 command	 your	 people	 to	 choose	 its	
good	advices;	soon	I	shall	show	you	people	
the	destination	of	the	disobedient.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hum	ne	uske	liye	takhtiyoñ	meiñ	likh	
di	 har	 cheez	 ki	 nasihat	 aur	 har	 cheez	 ki	
tafseel	 aur	 farmaya	 aey	 Mūsā' ise	
mazbooti	se	le	aur	apni	qaum	ko	ḥukm		de	
ke	iski	achchhi	bāteiñ	ikhtiyār	kareiñ		‘anqareeb	 maiñ	 tumheiñ	 dikhāoñ	 ga	 behukmoñ	ka	ghar

arabicText: سَأَصْرِفُ عَنْ ءَايَـٰتِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَتَكَبَّرُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ كُلَّ ءَايَةٍۢ لَّا يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِهَا وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ سَبِيلَ ٱلرُّشْدِ لَا يَتَّخِذُوهُ سَبِيلًۭا وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ سَبِيلَ ٱلْغَىِّ يَتَّخِذُوهُ سَبِيلًۭا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَكَانُوا۟ عَنْهَا غَـٰفِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	 I	shall	 turn	away	 from	My	signs	 the	
people	who	unjustly	wish	to	be	admired	in	
the	earth;	and	if	they	see	all	the	signs,	they	
would	not	believe	them;	and	if	they	see	the	
path	of	guidance,	they	would	not	prefer	to	
tread	it;	and	if	 they	 see	 the	way	 of	error,	
they	would	present	themselves	to	tread	it;	
that	is	because	they	denied	Our	signs	and	
were	ignoring	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Maiñ	 apni	 āayatoñ	 se	 unheiñ	 	 pher	
dooñga	 jo	 zameen	 meiñ	 na-haq	 apni	
badāyi	 chāhte	 haiñ	 aur	 agar	 sab	
nishāniyāñ	dekheiñ	un	par	Imān	na	lāayeñ		
aur	 agar	 hidāyat	 ki	 rāh	 dekheiñ	 us	 meiñ	
chalna	pasand	na	kareiñ		aur	gumrāhi	ka	
rāsta	nazar	pade	to	us	meiñ	chalne	ko	maujood	ho	jāyeñ	yeh	is	liye	ke	unhoñ	ne	Hamāri	āayateiñ	
jhutlāyiñ	aur	un	se	be	khabar	bane

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَلِقَآءِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ حَبِطَتْ أَعْمَـٰلُهُمْ ۚ هَلْ يُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 those who	 denied	Our	 signs	 and	 the	
confronting	 of	 the	 Hereafter	 - all	 their	
deeds	 are	 wasted;	 what	 recompense	 will	
they	get,	except	what	they	used	to	do?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jinhoñ	ne	hamāri	āayateiñ	aur	āakhirat	ke	darbār	(Āakhirat	ki	hāziri)	ko	jhutlāya	unka	sab	
kiya	dharā	akārat	gayā	unheiñ		kya	badla	milega	magar	wohi	jo	karte	they	.

arabicText: وَٱتَّخَذَ قَوْمُ مُوسَىٰ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ مِنْ حُلِيِّهِمْ عِجْلًۭا جَسَدًۭا لَّهُۥ خُوَارٌ ۚ أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّهُۥ لَا يُكَلِّمُهُمْ وَلَا يَهْدِيهِمْ سَبِيلًا ۘ ٱتَّخَذُوهُ وَكَانُوا۟ ظَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	behind	Moosa,	his	people	moulded	a	
calf	from	their	ornaments	- a	lifeless	body	
making	sounds	like	a	cow;	did	they	not	see	that	it	neither	speaks	to	them	nor	guides	them	in	any	
way?	They	chose	it	(for	worship),	and	were	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Mūsā ke	b’ad	uski	qaum	apne	zewaroñ	se	ek	bachhda	bana	baithi be-jān	ka	dhad	gāaye	ki	
tarah	āawāz	karta	kya	na	dekha	ke	woh	un	se	na	bāt	karta	hai	aur	na	unheiñ		kuchh	rāh	bataye	
usey	liya	aur	woh	Ƶālim	they

arabicText: وَلَمَّا سُقِطَ فِىٓ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَرَأَوْا۟ أَنَّهُمْ قَدْ ضَلُّوا۟ قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ يَرْحَمْنَا رَبُّنَا وَيَغْفِرْ لَنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	they	repented	and	realised	that	they	had	gone	astray,	they	said,	“If	our	Lord	does	not	
have	mercy	on	us	and	forgive	us,	we	are	ruined.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	pachtāaye	aur	samjhe	ke	hum	bahke	bole	agar	hamāra	Rab	hum	par	mehar	(Rahem-okaram)	na	kare	aur	hameiñ	na	bakhshe	to	hum	tabāh	huwe.”

arabicText: وَلَمَّا رَجَعَ مُوسَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ غَضْبَـٰنَ أَسِفًۭا قَالَ بِئْسَمَا خَلَفْتُمُونِى مِنۢ بَعْدِىٓ ۖ أَعَجِلْتُمْ أَمْرَ رَبِّكُمْ ۖ وَأَلْقَى ٱلْأَلْوَاحَ وَأَخَذَ بِرَأْسِ أَخِيهِ يَجُرُّهُۥٓ إِلَيْهِ ۚ قَالَ ٱبْنَ أُمَّ إِنَّ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱسْتَضْعَفُونِى وَكَادُوا۟ يَقْتُلُونَنِى فَلَا تُشْمِتْ بِىَ ٱلْأَعْدَآءَ وَلَا تَجْعَلْنِى مَعَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	Moosa	 returned	 to	 his	 people,	
angry	and	upset,	he	said,	“What	an	evil	way	
you	 have	 handled	 affairs	 on	 my	 behalf,	
behind	 me;	 did	 you	 hasten	 upon	 the	
command	of	your	Lord?”	And	he	cast	down	
the	stone	tablets,	and	catching	hold	of	his	
brothers	hair,	began	pulling	him	 towards	
him;	 said	 Haroon	 said,	 “O	 the	 son	 of	 my	
mother!	 The	 people	 thought	 I	 was	 weak	
and	would	have	probably	killed	me;	so	do	
not	make	my	enemies	laugh	at	me	and	do	
not	identify	me	with	the	unjust.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 Mūsā apni	 qaum	 ki	 taraf	 palta	
ghusse	 meiñ	 bharā	 jhuñjlāya	 huwa	 kahā	
tumne	 kya	buri	meri	ja-nasheeni	 ki	mere	
b’ad	kya tum	ne	apne	Rab	ke	ḥukm		se	jaldi	
ki	aur	takhtiyāñ	dāl	deiñ	aur	apne	bhai	ke	
sar	ke	bāl	pakad	kar	apni	taraf	kheeñchne	
laga	 kahā	 aey	 mere	 mā	 jāye	 qaum	 ne	
mujhe	 kamzor	 samjha	 aur	 qareeb	 tha	 ke	
mujhe	mār	dāleiñ	to	mujh	par	dushmanoñ	
ko	 na	 hañsa	 aur	 mujhe	 Ƶālimoñ	 meiñ	 na	
mila

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِأَخِى وَأَدْخِلْنَا فِى رَحْمَتِكَ ۖ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	 submitted,	 “My	 Lord!	 Forgive	me	 and	
my	brother	and	admit	us	into	Your	mercy;	
and	You	are	the	Most	Merciful	of	all	those	
who	show	mercy.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Árz	ki:	Aey	mere	Rab' Mujhe	aur	mere	bhai	
ko	bakhsh	de	aur	hameiñ	apni	Raḥmat	ke	
andar	 le	 le	 aur	 tu	 sab	 mehar	 (Rahem	
Karne)		waloñ		se	badh	kar	mehar	wāla	.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ ٱلْعِجْلَ سَيَنَالُهُمْ غَضَبٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ وَذِلَّةٌۭ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُفْتَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 those	 who	 took	 the	 calf	 - the	
punishment	 from	 their	 Lord,	 and	
humiliation	 will	 reach	 them	in	 the	 life	 of	
this	world;	and	this	is	the	way	We	reward	
those	who	fabricate	lies.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	 woh	 jo	 bachhda	 le	 baithe	 ‘anqareeb	 unheiñ	 	 unke	 Rab	 ka	 ghaƶab	 aur	
zillat	 pahuñchna	 hai	 duniya	 ki	 zindagi	
meiñ	 aur	 hum	 aisa	 hi	 badla	 dete	 haiñ	
bohtān	hāyoñ	(bohtān	bāñdh	ne	wāloñ)	ko

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ ثُمَّ تَابُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا وَءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا لَغَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 those	 who	 performed	 misdeeds	 and	
then	repented	and	accepted	faith	- so	after	
that,	 your	 Lord	 is	 Oft	 Forgiving,	 Most	
Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jinhoñ	 ne	 buraiyañ	 keeiñ	 aur	 unke	
b’ad	 tauba	 ki	 aur	 Imān	 lāye	 to	 iske	 b’ad	
tumhāra	 Rab	 bakhsh	 ne	 wāla	 maherbān	
hai

arabicText: وَلَمَّا سَكَتَ عَن مُّوسَى ٱلْغَضَبُ أَخَذَ ٱلْأَلْوَاحَ ۖ وَفِى نُسْخَتِهَا هُدًۭى وَرَحْمَةٌۭ لِّلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِرَبِّهِمْ يَرْهَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	 the	anger	 of	Moosa	abated,	 he	
picked up	 the	 stone	 tablets;	 and	 in	 their	
texts	 are	 guidance	 and	 mercy	 for	 those	
who	fear	their	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Mūsā ka	ghussa	thamā	(Door	huwa)	takhtiyāñ	utha	leeñ	aur	unki	tehreer	meiñ	hidayat	
aur	Raḥmat	hai	unke	liye	jo	apne	Rab	se	darte	haiñ	.

arabicText: وَٱخْتَارَ مُوسَىٰ قَوْمَهُۥ سَبْعِينَ رَجُلًۭا لِّمِيقَـٰتِنَا ۖ فَلَمَّآ أَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلرَّجْفَةُ قَالَ رَبِّ لَوْ شِئْتَ أَهْلَكْتَهُم مِّن قَبْلُ وَإِيَّـٰىَ ۖ أَتُهْلِكُنَا بِمَا فَعَلَ ٱلسُّفَهَآءُ مِنَّآ ۖ إِنْ هِىَ إِلَّا فِتْنَتُكَ تُضِلُّ بِهَا مَن تَشَآءُ وَتَهْدِى مَن تَشَآءُ ۖ أَنتَ وَلِيُّنَا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَٱرْحَمْنَا ۖ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْغَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Moosa	chose	seventy	men	from	his	people	for	Our	promise;	therefore	when	the	earthquake	
seized	them,	he	submitted,	“My	Lord!	If	You	had	willed	You	could	have	destroyed	them	and	me,	
even	earlier!	Will	You	destroy	us	for	the	deeds	which	the	ignorant	among	us	did?	That	is	not	but	
Your	testing	us;	with	it	You	send	astray	whomever	You	will	and	guide	whomever	You	will;	You	
are	our	Master,	so	forgive	us	and	have	mercy	on	us,	and	You	are	the	Best	of	the	Forgiving.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Mūsā ne	apni	qaum	se	sattar	mard	hamāre	w’āde	ke	liye	chune	phir	jab	unheiñ	zalzale	ne	liya	
Mūsā ne	‘arz	ki	aey	Rab	mere' Tu	chāhta	 to	pehle	hi	unheiñ		aur	mujhe	halāk	kar	deta	kya	 tu	
hameiñ	us	kām	par	halāk	farmāye	ga	jo	hamāre	be	aqloñ	ne	kiya	woh	nahi	magar	tera	āazmāna	
tu	us	se	behkāye	jise	chāhe	aur	rāh	dikhāye	jise	chāhe	tu	hamāra	maula	hai	to	hameiñ	bakhsh	de	
aur	hum	par	mehar	(Rahem-o-karam)	kar	aur	tu	sab	se	behtar	bakhsh	ne	wāla	hai.

arabicText: ۞ وَٱكْتُبْ لَنَا فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةًۭ وَفِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ إِنَّا هُدْنَآ إِلَيْكَ ۚ قَالَ عَذَابِىٓ أُصِيبُ بِهِۦ مَنْ أَشَآءُ ۖ وَرَحْمَتِى وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَىْءٍۢ ۚ فَسَأَكْتُبُهَا لِلَّذِينَ يَتَّقُونَ وَيُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	destine	good	for	us	in	this	world	and	
in	the	Hereafter	- We	have	indeed	inclined	
towards	 You”;	 He	 said,	 “I	 give	 My	
punishment	 to	 whomever	 I	 will;	 and	 My	
mercy	 encompasses	 all	 things;	 so	 I	 shall	
soon	 destine	 favours	 for	 those	 who	 fear	
and	 pay	 the	 charity,	 and	 they	 believe	 in	
Our	signs.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hamāre	liye	is	duniya	meiñ	bhalāi	likh	
aur	āakhirat	meiñ	be-shak	hum	 teri	 taraf	
ruju'	lāye,	farmaya:	Mera	‘aƶāb		maiñ	jise	
chahooñ	dooñ	aur	Meri	Raḥmat	har	cheez	
ko	ghere	hai	to	‘an-qareeb	maiñ	ne'matoñ	
ko	unke	liye	likh	dooñga	jo	darte	aur	Zakāt
dete	 haiñ	 aur	 woh	 hamāri	 āayatoñ	 par	
Imān	lāte	haiñ.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يَتَّبِعُونَ ٱلرَّسُولَ ٱلنَّبِىَّ ٱلْأُمِّىَّ ٱلَّذِى يَجِدُونَهُۥ مَكْتُوبًا عِندَهُمْ فِى ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةِ وَٱلْإِنجِيلِ يَأْمُرُهُم بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَىٰهُمْ عَنِ ٱلْمُنكَرِ وَيُحِلُّ لَهُمُ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ وَيُحَرِّمُ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْخَبَـٰٓئِثَ وَيَضَعُ عَنْهُمْ إِصْرَهُمْ وَٱلْأَغْلَـٰلَ ٱلَّتِى كَانَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ فَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِهِۦ وَعَزَّرُوهُ وَنَصَرُوهُ وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ ٱلنُّورَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُنزِلَ مَعَهُۥٓ ۙ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Those	 who	 will	 obey	 this	 Noble	
Messenger	 (Prophet	 Muhammad - peace	
and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him),	 the	Herald	 of	
the	Hidden	who	is	untutored	*	(except	by	
Allah),	whom	 they	will	 find	mentioned	in	
the	Taurat	and	the	Injeel	with	them;	he	will	
command	 them	 to	 do	 good	 and	 forbid	
them	from	wrong,	and	he	will	make	lawful	
for	 them	 the	 good	 clean	 things	 and	
prohibit	 the	 foul	 for	 them,	 and	 he	 will	
unburden	 the	 loads	 and	 the	 neck	 chains	
which	 were	 upon	 them;	 so	 those	 who	
believe	in	him,	and	revere**	him,	and	help	
him,	and	follow	the	light	which	came	down	
with	him	- it	is	they	who	have	succeeded."	
(*The	 Holy	 Prophet	 was	 taught	 by	 Allah
Himself	 - see	 Surah	 55	 Al-Rahman.	 **To	
honour	 the	 Holy	 Prophet	 – peace	 and	
blessings	be	upon	him	– is	part	of	faith.	To	
disrespect	him	is	blasphemy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	 jo	 ghulami	 kareñ	 ge us	 Rasool	 be	
padhe	ghaib	ki	khabreiñ	dene	wāle	ki	jise	
likha	huwa	pāyeñge	apne	pās	Taurait aur	
Injeel meiñ	 woh	 unheiñ	 	 bhalai	 ka	 ḥukm		
dega	 aur	 burayi	 se	 man’a	 farmāyega	 aur	
suthri	cheezeiñ	unke	liye	halāl	farmāyega	
aur	 gandi	 cheezeiñ	 un	 par	 harām	 karega	
aur	un	par	se	woh	bojh	aur	gale	ke	phande	
jo	 un	 par	 they	 utāre	 ga	 to	 woh	jo	 us	 par	
imān	lāyeiñ	 aur	 uski	 ta'zeem	 kareiñ	 	 aur	
usey	madad	deiñ	aur	us	noor	ki	pairwi	kareiñ		jo	uske	sāth	utra	wohi	ba-murād	huwe	.

arabicText: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِنِّى رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ إِلَيْكُمْ جَمِيعًا ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ ۖ فَـَٔامِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ٱلنَّبِىِّ ٱلْأُمِّىِّ ٱلَّذِى يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ وَكَلِمَـٰتِهِۦ وَٱتَّبِعُوهُ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say	(O	 dear	 Prophet	Muhammad - peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him),	 “O	 people!	 Indeed	 I	 am,	
towards	 you	all,	 the	Noble	Messenger	 of	Allah - for	Whom	(Allah)	only	is	 the	 kingship	 of	 the	
heavens	and	the	earth;	there	is	none	worthy	of	worship,	except	Him	- giving	life	and	giving	death;	
therefore	 believe	in	Allah and	His	Noble	Messenger,	 the	Prophet	who	is	untutored	(except	 by	
Allah),	who	 believes	in	Allah and	His Words,	and	 obey	 him	(the	 Prophet)	to	attain	guidance.”	
(Prophet	Muhammad – peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him	– is	the	Prophet	towards	all	mankind.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo		aey	logo:	Maiñ	tum	sab	ki	taraf	us	Allah	ka	Rasool	hooñ	ke	āasmānon	aur	zameen	ki	
bādshahi	usi	ko	hai	uske	siwa	koi	ma'bood	nahi	jilāye	aur	māre	(Zindagi	aur	Maut	de)	to	Imān	
lāo	Allah	aur	uske	Rasool	be-padhe	ghaib	batāne	wāle	par	ke	Allah	aur	uski	bātoñ	par	imān	lātey	
haiñ	aur	unki	ghulami	karo	ke	tum	rāh	pāo.

arabicText: وَمِن قَوْمِ مُوسَىٰٓ أُمَّةٌۭ يَهْدُونَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَبِهِۦ يَعْدِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	the	people	of	Moosa	is	a	group	that	shows	the	true	path,	and	establishes	justice	with	
it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Mūsā ki	qaum	se	ek	giroh	hai	ke	haq	ki	rāh	batātā	aur	usi	se	insāf	karta.

arabicText: وَقَطَّعْنَـٰهُمُ ٱثْنَتَىْ عَشْرَةَ أَسْبَاطًا أُمَمًۭا ۚ وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ إِذِ ٱسْتَسْقَىٰهُ قَوْمُهُۥٓ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْحَجَرَ ۖ فَٱنۢبَجَسَتْ مِنْهُ ٱثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ عَيْنًۭا ۖ قَدْ عَلِمَ كُلُّ أُنَاسٍۢ مَّشْرَبَهُمْ ۚ وَظَلَّلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْغَمَـٰمَ وَأَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْمَنَّ وَٱلسَّلْوَىٰ ۖ كُلُوا۟ مِن طَيِّبَـٰتِ مَا رَزَقْنَـٰكُمْ ۚ وَمَا ظَلَمُونَا وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	divided	them	into	twelve	tribes,	as	
separate	 groups;	 and	 when	 his	 people	
asked	 him	 for	 water,	 We	 revealed	 to	
Moosa,	“Strike	the	rock	with	your	staff”;	so	
twelve	springs	gushed	 forth	 from	it;	each	
group	 recognised	 its	 drinking-place;	 and	
We	made	 the	 clouds	a	 canopy	 over	 them	
and	 sent	 down	 the	Manna	and	 the	Salwa	
(birds)	on	them;	“Eat	of	the	good	things	we	
have	 provided	 you”;	 and	 they	 did	 not	
wrong	 Us	 in	 the	 least,	 but	 they	 used	 to	
wrong	themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 hum	 ne	 unheiñ	 	 bāñt	 diya	 bārah	
qabeele	giroh	giroh	aur hum	ne	Waḥi bheji	
Mūsā ko	 jab	 us	 se	 uski	 qaum	 ne	 pāni	
māñga	ke	is	patthar	par	apna	‘asā	māro	to	
us	meiñ	se	bārah	chashme	phoot	nikle	har	
giroh	ne	apna	ghāt	pehchān	liya	aur	hum	
ne	 un	 par	 abr	 sayebān	 kiya	 aur	 un	 par	
man-o-salwa	 utāra	 khāo	 hamāri	 di	 huyi	
pāk	cheezeiñ	aur	unhoñ	ne	hamāra	kuchh	
nuqsān	na	kiya	lekin	apni	hi	jānoñ		ka	bura	
karte	they.

arabicText: وَإِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱسْكُنُوا۟ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْقَرْيَةَ وَكُلُوا۟ مِنْهَا حَيْثُ شِئْتُمْ وَقُولُوا۟ حِطَّةٌۭ وَٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْبَابَ سُجَّدًۭا نَّغْفِرْ لَكُمْ خَطِيٓـَٔـٰتِكُمْ ۚ سَنَزِيدُ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 when	 they	 were	
commanded,	“Reside	in	this	township	and	
eat	whatever	you	wish	in	it,	and	say	‘Sins	
are	 forgiven’	 and	 enter	 the	 gate	
prostrating	- We	will	forgive	you	your	sins;	
We	 shall	 soon	 bestow	 more	 upon	 the	
virtuous.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 yād	 karo	 jab	 un	 se	 farmaya	 gaya	 us	
shaher	 meiñ	 baso	 aur	 us	 meiñ	 jo	 chāho	
khāo	 aur	 kaho	 gunah	 utre	 (Aey	 Allah	
hamāre	 gunah	 bakhsh	 de)	 aur	 darwāze	
meiñ	 sajda	 karte	 dākhil	 ho	 hum	 tumhāre	
gunah	bakhsh	deñge	‘an-qareeb	nekoñ	ko	ziyada	‘aṭa	farmāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: فَبَدَّلَ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ قَوْلًا غَيْرَ ٱلَّذِى قِيلَ لَهُمْ فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِجْزًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَظْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	 the	 unjust	 among	 them	 changed	 the	
words,	 contrary	 to	 what	 they	 had	 been	
commanded	- consequently	We	sent	down	
upon	them	a	punishment	from	the	sky	-the	
recompense	of	their	injustice.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 un	meiñ	 ke	 Ƶālimoñ	 ne	 bāt	 badal	 di	 uske	 khilāf	jiska	 unheiñ	ḥukm	 tha	 to	Hum	 ne	 un	 par	
āasmān	se	‘aƶāb		bheja	badla	unke	zulm	ka

arabicText: وَسْـَٔلْهُمْ عَنِ ٱلْقَرْيَةِ ٱلَّتِى كَانَتْ حَاضِرَةَ ٱلْبَحْرِ إِذْ يَعْدُونَ فِى ٱلسَّبْتِ إِذْ تَأْتِيهِمْ حِيتَانُهُمْ يَوْمَ سَبْتِهِمْ شُرَّعًۭا وَيَوْمَ لَا يَسْبِتُونَ ۙ لَا تَأْتِيهِمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَبْلُوهُم بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْسُقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	ask	them	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad
- peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	of	 the	
township	that	was	by	the	sea;	when	they	used	to	exceed	in	the matter	of	the	Sabbath	- when	their	
fish	used	to	come	swimming	atop	the	water	in	front	of	them	on	the	day	of	Sabbath	and	not	come	
on	the	days	it	was	not	Sabbath;	this	is	how	We	used	to	test	them,	due	to	their	disobedience.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	se	hāl	poochho	us	basti	ka	ke dariya	kināre	thi	jab	woh	hafte	ke	bāre	meiñ	had	se	badhte	
jab	hafte	ke	din	unki	machhliyāñ	pāni	par	tairti	unke	sāmne	āateiñ	aur	jo	din	hafte	ka	na	hota	na	
āateiñ	is	tarah	hum	unheiñ		āazmāte	they	unki	be	hukmi	ke	sabab.
